pages.title: Bronze
pages.text: Making bronze is rather easy. By combining about 3 copper to 1 tin into a bronze compound dust, melting them together in a $(thing)kiln$() at a relatively low melting point of around 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit will yield 4 bronze.
This material is much more durable and ductile than the copper used to make it, making its use for tools that much better. I also might also be able to make better parts because of its toughness.
